name: market for chicken for slaughtering, live weight | chicken for slaughtering, live weight | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/7029/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'chicken for slaughtering, live weight', in the Global geography.;Transport from producers to consumers of this product in the geography covered by the market is included.;The product 'chicken for slaughtering, live weight' is an animal farmed for meat. Chickens are typically farmed for 6 weeks. The product represents the animal alive before transferring and processing in a slaughterhouse.

This activity starts at the gate of the activities that produce 'chicken for slaughtering, live weight',  within the geography of Global.

This activity ends with the supply of 'chicken for slaughtering, live weight',  to the consumers of this product. Transport is included. Product losses during transportation are assumed negligible and are therefore not included.

exchanges.description: Transport distance based on US BTS Commodity Flow Surveys 1993, 1997, 2002, 2007, US Dep. Of Transportation, Bureau of Transportation Statistics. Of the total road transport, 6% is assumed to be by delivery van for goods with a large share of retail sale, and 3% for goods that are mainly sold via wholesale.
